column2: LOUISIANA PERMIT TEST
column4: Louisiana

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column6: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.

column2: 2. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: There are four stop signs at the intersection.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.

column2: 3. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column6: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.
column8: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column10: proceed with caution until you see a train.

column2: 4. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: Regulatory.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 5. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column4: on narrow roads.

column2: 6. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column10: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 7. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right

column2: 9. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.

column2: 10. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Allow others to merge smoothly.
column6: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column8: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Steep grade ahead

column2: 12. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian.
column6: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 13. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column6: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column8: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column10: stare straight ahead at all times.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 15. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 16. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: pavement conditions.
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 17. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: do not enter

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 19. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column8: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 20. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are fatigued.
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.

column2: 21. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column4: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 22. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull the steering wheel back.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 23. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
column4: double solid yellow

column2: 24. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column10: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 26. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 27. This road sign means:
column4: No Turning

column2: 28. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right

column2: 30. The yield sign means:
column4: Go. The light will soon be red.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 31. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column6: the lane to the left may pass.
column8: passing is permitted in either direction.
column10: the lane to the right may pass.

column2: 32. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 33. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.

column2: 34. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column4: put on your emergency flashers.
column6: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 35. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 36. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 37. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.
column6: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column8: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column10: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.

column2: 38. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column4: .08% or higher.

column2: 39. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: increase

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: No turns are allowed on this road
